Pyramid Technologies PTalk API - Version 1.0.0.0

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api
Contains all helper and worker classes relevant to to communication with a
slave device.
com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api.event
Contains all events that a slave device is capable of generating.
In RS-232, a slave is always in one state and events may occur at any order
Please see the documentation in Events

Pyramid Technologies PTalk API - Version 1.0.0.0

This API is designed to support all of our bill validator products. This first release targets the RS-232 protocol and supports a subset of planned features for this interface. The default settings for this API will work with our bill validators and any other RS-232,standard compliant bill validator.
Currently supported commands:

  • Polling: Set the rate at which the slave is polled
  • Escrow Mode: Enable or disable escrow mode
  • Individual Bill Enables: As a master, set the individual bills to accept or reject
  • COM Port Support: All DB9 or USB UART COM ports supported by your OS will work with this API
  • Slave Events: Subscribe to all, some, or none of the slave-generated events
  • Debugging: Logging and debug buffer to help trace issues to their source
  • Extensibility: This API is designed for customization and extensions

    • Hardware Requirements

    Some of our products support RS-232 right out of the box. See the table below for what you will need:
    • Apex 5000: All standard firmwares
    • Apex 7000: All standard firmwares
    • Trilogy: Requires RS-232 firmware for API revision 1.0
    • Curve: Requires RS-232 firmware for API revision 1.0

    Serial Connection Requirements

    All bill validators will require a communication harness. It is recommended that you acquire one of the following before proceeding:
    • Recommended Harness
    • DB9 RS-232 connection, USB UART cable of your choice

    Roadmap

    • ccTalk Support
    • Extended command set
    • Reset Slave
    • Status and Firmware Information
    • Acceptor configuration reports
    • Flash updating
    • Auditable transaction logs
    • More devices??
